meanings.definition: To lower in importance or value.
meanings.sent1: She was downgrading her old phone to give to her younger sister.
meanings.sent2: The company decided to start downgrading their prices to attract more customers.
meanings.sent3: The magician joked that he was downgrading his disappearing act to make things more interesting.
meanings.sent4: The teacher felt like she was downgrading her lesson plan by simplifying it for the students.
meanings.sent5: The chef was downgrading the recipe by using cheaper ingredients, but it still tasted delicious.

meanings.definition: The act of reducing the quality or status of something.
meanings.sent1: The downgrading of the hotel's services led to many negative reviews.
meanings.sent2: After the downgrading of the software, many users experienced glitches and errors.
meanings.sent3: The downgrading of the superhero's powers made for a hilarious comic book storyline.
meanings.sent4: The downgrading of the movie's special effects disappointed many viewers.
meanings.sent5: The downgrading of the restaurant's menu left customers searching for new dining options.

meanings.definition: To assign a lower rank or rating to something.
meanings.sent1: The professor was downgrading the students' essays based on grammar mistakes.
meanings.sent2: The judge decided to start downgrading the contestant's performances due to lack of effort.
meanings.sent3: The coach was downgrading the team's overall performance to motivate them to work harder.
meanings.sent4: The manager was downgrading the employee's performance reviews after repeated tardiness.
meanings.sent5: The critic was downgrading the movie's rating, much to the disappointment of the filmmakers.
